newsitem.title: MEXICO: Mexico's President Zedillo says employment growing.
newsitem.headline: Mexico's President Zedillo says employment growing.

text.p: Mexican President Ernesto Zedillo said Wednesday a record 9.1 million workers were permanently affiliated with the Social Security Institute (IMSS) at the end of November.
"This is the first time that the nine million workers registered mark has been surpassed," he told businessmen and diplomats in a ceremony awarding the "National Export Award."
Zedillo said the figure indicates a rebound in employment by 600,000 jobs since the end of 1995. At the end of August, there were 8.867 million workers registered at the IMSS.

The IMSS covers all workers legally registered on payrolls, excluding central government civil servants. As a government agency, the IMSS provides those affiliated with it a broad range of services, including health care and pension payments.
"The Mexican economy is beginning a new stage of growth with greater foundation," he said. "Today we have a goal to convert the recovery that has begun to vigorous and sustained growth.
